member.name: F:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation.hProcess
member.summary: A handle to the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the process in all functions that perform operations on the process object.

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation.hThread
member.summary: A handle to the primary thread of the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the thread in all functions that perform operations on the thread object.

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation.dwProcessId
member.summary: A value that can be used to identify a process. The value is valid from the time the process is created until all handles to the process are closed and the process object is freed; at this point, the identifier may be reused.

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation.dwThreadId
member.summary: A value that can be used to identify a thread. The value is valid from the time the thread is created until all handles to the thread are closed and the thread object is freed; at this point, the identifier may be reused.

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation.sessionId
member.summary: 與此資訊相關的工作階段 ID

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.runProcessBypassUAC(System.String,System.Nullable{System.UInt32},TEC.Core.Management.ApplicationLoader.ProcessInformation@)
member.summary: 以系統管理員模式執行指定路徑之應用程式，並忽略 UAC 控制。注意: 此程式碼應於 Windows Service 中以系統身分執行時有效。
member.param: 要執行應用程式的完整路徑
已建立的應用程式相關資訊
工作階段 ID，若要以目前工作階段執行，則輸入 null 參考
member.returns: 回傳是否成功建立應用程式
member.remarks: 若要取得所有可用的工作階段，請參考 TEC.Core.DirectoryService.WTSManagement.WTSUserLoader 之範例

example.code: bool isSuccess = ApplicationLoader.runProcessBypassUAC(@"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe", null, out processInformation);

Minimum supported client:Windows 2000 Professional
Minimum supported server:Windows 2000 Server
Namespace:\root\CIMV2
MOF:Cimwin32.mof
DLL:Cimwin32.dll

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.ArpAlwaysSourceRoute
member.summary: 設定或取得ArpAlwaysSourceRoute
member.remarks: If TRUE, TCP/IP transmits Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) queries with source routing enabled on Token Ring networks. By default (FALSE), ARP first queries without source routing, and then retries with source routing enabled if no reply is received. Source routing allows the routing of network packets across different types of networks.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.ArpUseEtherSNAP
member.summary: 設定或取得ArpUseEtherSNAP
member.remarks: If TRUE, Ethernet packets follow the IEEE 802.3 Sub-Network Access Protocol (SNAP) encoding. Setting this parameter to 1 forces TCP/IP to transmit Ethernet packets by using 802.3 SNAP encoding. By default (FALSE), the stack transmits packets in DIX Ethernet format. Windows 2000 systems can receive both formats.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.Caption
member.summary: 設定或取得Caption
member.remarks: Description of the CIM_Setting object—a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DatabasePath
member.summary: 設定或取得DatabasePath
member.remarks: Valid Windows file path to standard Internet database files (HOSTS, LMHOSTS, NETWORKS, and PROTOCOLS). The file path is used by the Windows Sockets interface. This property is only available on computer systems running Windows 2000.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DeadGWDetectEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得DeadGWDetectEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, dead gateway detection occurs. With this feature enabled, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) asks Internet Protocol (IP) to change to a backup gateway if it retransmits a segment several times without receiving a response.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultIPGateway
member.summary: 設定或取得預設閘道
member.remarks: Array of IP addresses of default gateways that the computer system uses.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultTOS
member.summary: 設定或取得DefaultTOS
member.remarks: Default Type Of Service (TOS) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets. Request for Comments (RFC) 791 defines the values. Default: 0 (zero), Valid Range: 0 - 255.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultTTL
member.summary: 設定或取得DefaultTTL
member.remarks: Default Time To Live (TTL) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets. The TTL specifies the number of routers an IP packet can pass through to reach its destination before being discarded. Each router decrements by one the TTL count of a packet as it passes through and discards the packets—if the TTL is 0 (zero). Default: 32, Valid Range: 1 - 255.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.Description
member.summary: 設定或取得Description
member.remarks: Description of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得DHCP是否已啟用
member.remarks: If TRUE, the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server automatically assigns an IP address to the computer system when establishing a network connection.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPLeaseExpires
member.summary: 設定或取得DHCP租用到期時間
member.remarks: Expiration date and time for a leased IP address that was assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPLeaseObtained
member.summary: 設定或取得DHCP租約起始時間
member.remarks: Date and time the lease was obtained for the IP address assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPServer
member.summary: 設定或取得DHCP伺服器
member.remarks: IP address of the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSDomain
member.summary: 設定或取得DNS網域
member.remarks: Organization name followed by a period and an extension that indicates the type of organization, such as microsoft.com. The name can be any combination of the letters A through Z, the numerals 0 through 9, and the hyphen (-), plus the period (.) character used as a separator.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSDomainSuffixSearchOrder
member.summary: 設定或取得DNS搜尋網域的順序
member.remarks: Array of DNS domain suffixes to be appended to the end of host names during name resolution. When attempting to resolve a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) from a host-only name, the system will first append the local domain name. If this is not successful, the system will use the domain suffix list to create additional FQDNs in the order listed and query DNS servers for each.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSEnabledForWINSResolution
member.summary: 設定或取得DNSEnabledForWINSResolution
member.remarks: If TRUE, the Domain Name System (DNS) is enabled for name resolution over Windows Internet Naming Service (WINS) resolution. If the name cannot be resolved using DNS, the name request is forwarded to WINS for resolution.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSHostName
member.summary: 設定或取得DNS主機名稱
member.remarks: Host name used to identify the local computer for authentication by some utilities. Other TCP/IP-based utilities can use this value to acquire the name of the local computer. Host names are stored on DNS servers in a table that maps names to IP addresses for use by DNS. The name can be any combination of the letters A through Z, the numerals 0 through 9, and the hyphen (-), plus the period (.) character used as a separator. By default, this value is the Microsoft networking computer name, but the network administrator can assign another host name without affecting the computer name.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSServerSearchOrder
member.summary: 設定或取得DNS Server的順序
member.remarks: Array of server IP addresses to be used in querying for DNS servers.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.DomainDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得DomainDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, the IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the domain name of this connection in addition to being registered under the computer's full DNS name. The domain name of this connection is either set using the SetDNSDomain() method or assigned by DSCP. The registered name is the host name of the computer with the domain name appended. Windows 2000: This property is not available.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.ForwardBufferMemory
member.summary: 設定或取得ForwardBufferMemory
member.remarks: Memory allocated by IP to store packet data in the router packet queue. When this buffer space is filled, the router begins discarding packets at random from its queue. Packet queue data buffers are 256 bytes in length, so the value of this parameter should be a multiple of 256. Multiple buffers are chained together for larger packets. The IP header for a packet is stored separately. This parameter is ignored and no buffers are allocated if the IP router is not enabled. The buffer size can range from the network MTU to a value smaller than 0xFFFFFFFF. Default: 74240 (fifty 1480-byte packets, rounded to a multiple of 256).

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.FullDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得FullDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, the IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the computer's full DNS name. The full DNS name of the computer is displayed on the Network Identification tab in the System application in Control Panel.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.GatewayCostMetric
member.summary: 設定或取得GatewayCostMetric
member.remarks: Array of integer cost metric values (ranging from 1 to 9999) to be used in calculating the fastest, most reliable, or least resource-intensive routes. This argument has a one-to-one correspondence with the DefaultIPGateway property.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IGMPLevel
member.summary: 設定或取得IGMPLevel
member.remarks: Extent to which the system supports IP multicast and participates in the Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP). At level 0 (zero), the system provides no multicast support. At level 1, the system may only send IP multicast packets. At level 2, the system may send IP multicast packets and fully participate in IGMP to receive multicast packets.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.Index
member.summary: 設定或取得Index
member.remarks: Index number of the Windows network adapter configuration. The index number is used when there is more than one configuration available.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.InterfaceIndex
member.summary: 設定或取得InterfaceIndex
member.remarks: Index value that uniquely identifies a local network interface. The value in this property is the same as the value in the InterfaceIndex property in the instance of Win32_IP4RouteTable that represents the network interface in the route table. Windows XP and Windows 2000: This property is not available.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPAddress
member.summary: 設定或取得IP位址
member.remarks: Array of all of the IP addresses associated with the current network adapter. Starting with Windows Vista, this property can contain either IPv6 addresses or IPv4 addresses. For more information, see IPv6 and IPv4 Support in WMI.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPConnectionMetric
member.summary: 設定或取得IPConnectionMetric
member.remarks: Cost of using the configured routes for the IP bound adapter and is the weighted value for those routes in the IP routing table. If there are multiple routes to a destination in the IP routing table, the route with the lowest metric is used. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得網卡是否已啟用
member.remarks: If TRUE, TCP/IP is bound and enabled on this network adapter.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPFilterSecurityEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得IPFilterSecurityEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, IP port security is enabled globally across all IP-bound network adapters and the security values associated with individual network adapters are in effect. This property is used in conjunction with IPSecPermitTCPPorts, IPSecPermitUDPPorts, and IPSecPermitIPProtocols. If FALSE, IP filter security is disabled across all network adapters and allows all port and protocol traffic to flow unfiltered.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPSecPermitIPProtocols
member.summary: 設定或取得IPSecPermitIPProtocols
member.remarks: Array of the protocols permitted to run over the IP. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero) indicates access permission is granted for all protocols. An empty string indicates that no protocols are permitted to run when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPSecPermitTCPPorts
member.summary: 設定或取得IPSecPermitTCPPorts
member.remarks: Array of the ports that will be granted access permission for TCP. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero)indicates access permission is granted for all ports. An empty string indicates that no ports are granted access permission when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPSecPermitUDPPorts
member.summary: 設定或取得IPSecPermitUDPPorts
member.remarks: Array of the ports that will be granted User Datagram Protocol (UDP) access permission. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero) indicates access permission is granted for all ports. An empty string indicates that no ports are granted access permission when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPSubnet
member.summary: 設定或取得所有子網路遮罩
member.remarks: Array of all of the subnet masks associated with the current network adapter.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPUseZeroBroadcast
member.summary: 設定或取得IPUseZeroBroadcast
member.remarks: If TRUE, IP zeros-broadcasts are used (0.0.0.0), and the system uses ones-broadcasts (255.255.255.255). Computer systems generally use ones-broadcasts, but those derived from BSD implementations use zeros-broadcasts. Systems that do not use that same broadcasts will not interoperate on the same network. The default is FALSE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXAddress
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXAddress
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) address of the network adapter. The IPX address identifies a computer system on a network using the IPX protocol.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXEnabled
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: If TRUE, the or Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) protocol is bound and enabled for this adapter.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXFrameType
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXFrameType
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: Array of frame-type identifiers. The values in this array correspond to the elements in IPXNetworkNumber.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXMediaType
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXMediaType
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) media-type identifier.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXNetworkNumber
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXNetworkNumber
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: Array of characters that uniquely identifies a frame or network adapter combination on the computer system. The NetWare Link (NWLink) IPX/SPX-compatible transport in Windows 2000 and later use two distinctly different types of network numbers. This number is sometimes referred to as the external network number. It must be unique for each network segment. The order in this string list will correspond item-for-item with the elements in the IPXFrameType property.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPXVirtualNetNumber
member.summary: 設定或取得IPXVirtualNetNumber
member.remarks:
Starting with Windows Vista, the Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) technology is no longer supported and this property does not contain useful data.
Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000: Unique identifier of the computer system on the network. It is represented in the form of an eight-character hexadecimal digit. Windows 2000 uses the virtual network number (also known as an internal network number) for internal routing.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: 設定或取得KeepAliveInterval(Milliseconds)
member.remarks: The KeepAliveTime property indicates how often the TCP attempts to verify that an idle connection is still intact by sending a Keep Alive Packet. A remote system that is reachable will acknowledge the keep alive transmission. Keep Alive packets are not sent by default. This feature may be enabled in a connection by an application. Default: 7,200,000 (two hours).

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.KeepAliveTime
member.summary: 設定或取得KeepAliveTime(Milliseconds)
member.remarks: The KeepAliveTime property indicates how often the TCP attempts to verify that an idle connection is still intact by sending a Keep Alive Packet. A remote system that is reachable will acknowledge the keep alive transmission. Keep Alive packets are not sent by default. This feature may be enabled in a connection by an application. Default: 7,200,000 (two hours).

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.MACAddress
member.summary: 設定或取得MAC位址
member.remarks: Media Access Control (MAC) address of the network adapter. A MAC address is assigned by the manufacturer to uniquely identify the network adapter.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.MTU
member.summary: 設定或取得MTU
member.remarks: Overrides the default Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) for a network interface. The MTU is the maximum packet size (including the transport header) that the transport will transmit over the underlying network. The IP datagram can span multiple packets. The range of this value spans the minimum packet size (68) to the MTU supported by the underlying network.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.NumForwardPackets
member.summary: 設定或取得NumForwardPackets
member.remarks: Number of IP packet headers allocated for the router packet queue. When all headers are in use, the router will begin to discard packets from the queue at random. This value should be at least as large as the ForwardBufferMemory value divided by the maximum IP data size of the networks connected to the router. It should be no larger than the ForwardBufferMemory value divided by 256, since at least 256 bytes of forward buffer memory are used for each packet. The optimal number of forward packets for a given ForwardBufferMemory size depends on the type of traffic on the network. It will be somewhere between these two values. If the router is not enabled, this parameter is ignored and no headers are allocated. Default: 50, Valid Range: 1 - 0xFFFFFFFE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.PMTUBHDetectEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得PMTUBHDetectEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, detection of black hole routers occurs while TCP discovers the path of the Maximum Transmission Unit. A black hole router does not return ICMP Destination Unreachable messages when it needs to fragment an IP datagram with the Don't Fragment bit set. TCP depends on receiving these messages to perform Path MTU Discovery. With this feature enabled, TCP will try to send segments without the Don't Fragment bit set if several retransmissions of a segment go unacknowledged. If the segment is acknowledged as a result, the MSS will be decreased and the Don't Fragment bit will be set in future packets on the connection. Enabling black hole detection increases the maximum number of retransmissions performed for a given segment. The default value of this property is FALSE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.PMTUDiscoveryEnabled
member.summary: 設定或取得PMTUDiscoveryEnabled
member.remarks: If TRUE, the Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) path is discovered over the path to a remote host. By discovering the MTU path and limiting TCP segments to this size, TCP can eliminate fragmentation at routers along the path that connect networks with different MTUs. Fragmentation adversely affects TCP throughput and network congestion. Setting this parameter to FALSE causes an MTU of 576 bytes to be used for all connections that are not to machines on the local subnet. The default is TRUE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.ServiceName
member.summary: 設定或取得ServiceName
member.remarks: Service name of the network adapter. This name is usually shorter than the full product name.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.SettingID
member.summary: 設定或取得SettingID
member.remarks: Identifier by which the CIM_Setting object is known. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpipNetbiosOptions
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpipNetbiosOptions
member.remarks: Bitmap of the possible settings related to NetBIOS over TCP/IP.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpMaxConnectRetransmissions
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpMaxConnectRetransmissions
member.remarks: Number of times TCP attempts to retransmit a Connect Request before terminating the connection. The initial retransmission timeout is 3 seconds. The retransmission timeout doubles for each attempt. Default: 3, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpMaxDataRetransmissions
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpMaxDataRetransmissions
member.remarks: Number of times TCP retransmits an individual data segment (nonconnect segment) before terminating the connection. The retransmission timeout doubles with each successive retransmission on a connection. Default: 5, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpNumConnections
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpNumConnections
member.remarks: Maximum number of connections that TCP can have open simultaneously. Default: 0xFFFFFE, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer
member.remarks: If TRUE, TCP uses the RFC 1122 specification for urgent data. If FALSE (default), TCP uses the mode used by Berkeley Software Design (BSD) derived systems. The two mechanisms interpret the urgent pointer differently and are not interoperable. The default value is FALSE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpWindowSize
member.summary: 設定或取得TcpWindowSize
member.remarks: Maximum TCP Receive Window size offered by the system. The Receive Window specifies the number of bytes a sender may transmit without receiving an acknowledgment. In general, larger receiving windows will improve performance over high-delay and high-bandwidth networks. For efficiency, the receiving window should be an even multiple of the TCP Maximum Segment Size (MSS). Default: Four times the maximum TCP data size or an even multiple of TCP data size rounded up to the nearest multiple of 8192. Ethernet networks default to 8760. Valid range: 0 - 65535.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSEnableLMHostsLookup
member.summary: 設定或取得WINSEnableLMHostsLookup
member.remarks: If TRUE, local lookup files are used. Lookup files will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If they exist on the local system, they will be found in %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSHostLookupFile
member.summary: 設定或取得WINSHostLookupFile
member.remarks: Path to a WINS lookup file on the local system. This file will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If the file specified in this property is found, it will be copied to the %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc folder of the local system. Valid only if the WINSEnableLMHostsLookup property is TRUE.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSPrimaryServer
member.summary: 設定或取得WINSPrimaryServer
member.remarks: IP address for the primary WINS server.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSScopeID
member.summary: 設定或取得WINSScopeID
member.remarks: Value appended to the end of the NetBIOS name that isolates a group of computer systems communicating with only each other. It is used for all NetBIOS transactions over TCP/IP communications from that computer system. Computers configured with identical scope identifiers are able to communicate with this computer. TCP/IP clients with different scope identifiers disregard packets from computers with this scope identifier. Valid only when the EnableWINS method executes successfully.

member.name: P:TEC.Core.Management.Net.Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSSecondaryServer
member.summary: 設定或取得WINSSecondaryServer
member.remarks: IP address for the secondary WINS server.

member.name: T:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.AuthenticationPrompt
member.summary: 利用Windows內建的UI來提示使用者輸入密碼

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.AuthenticationPrompt.CredUIPromptForCredentials(TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUI_INFO@,System.String,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUI_FLAGS)
member.summary: 本方法將建立以及顯示讓使用者可以輸入認證資訊的視窗，若系統為Vista或Windows Server 2008以上，請改用
member.param: 輸入自訂認證視窗的參數
包含要認證目標的資訊，通常是ServerName，對於分散式檔案系統而言， 應該會輸入ServerName\ShareName格式的字串。這個參數也用於認證管理員的識別資訊。
這個值為保留值，以便未來擴充用，目前值必須填入IntPtr.Zero
定義需要認證視窗的原因，可以輸入關於視窗錯誤的參數， 如果要取得關於最近一次所發生的Unmanaged錯誤，可以使用Marshal.GetLastWin32Error();來取得， 其他錯誤碼的詳細資訊請參考 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms681382(v=vs.85).aspx
使用者名稱，如果輸入的參數長度不為0，則認證訊息視窗的使用者名稱就會預先填入該參數作為前置字串
在pszUserName參數允許的最大值
密碼，如果輸入的參數長度不為0，則認證訊息視窗的密碼就會預先填入該參數作為前置字串
在pszPassword參數允許的最大值
當flags參數的值有設定時，雖然"儲存密碼"的方塊不會顯示， 但是還是會依照輸入的值來決定是否要儲存密碼；時， 既不會顯示"儲存密碼"的方塊，也預設為不儲存認證，則本參數的值會被忽略
客製化選項
member.returns: 執行結果的狀態

remarks.para: 關於詳細原文說明，請參考 http://msdn.microsoft.com/zh-tw/library/aa375177.aspx

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.AuthenticationPrompt.CredUIPromptForWindowsCredentials(TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUI_INFO@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@,System.Boolean@,TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUIWIN)
member.summary: 本方法將建立以及顯示讓使用者可以透過本機電腦已安裝的認證提供者來輸入認證資訊的視窗
member.param: 自訂認證視窗的UI。 如果為IntPtr.Zero， 則視窗將出現於螢幕正中間，如果不為IntPtr.Zero， 則視窗將出現於父視窗的中間。

定義於Winerror.h的Windows錯誤代碼，這會顯示在認證視窗中。如果先前的認證未通過， 則呼叫端應該使用這個參數來將先前發生的錯誤訊息(例:Winlogon)傳遞到此方法中(如:Marshal.GetLastWin32Error();)，相對應的訊息會呈現於認證視窗中， 如果不顯示任何錯誤訊息，請輸入0，詳細資訊請參考 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms681382(v=vs.85).aspx
這個參數的值將會用於認證套件，該認證是被序列化存放於InAuthBuffer的參數中，相關的資訊請參考 http://msdn.microsoft.com/zh-tw/library/aa378297.aspx
將BLOB認證(Credential BLOB)填入到認證視窗中，如果要保留空白，應填入InPtr.Zero
pvInAuthBuffer的大小，單位為byte
BLOB認證(Credential BLOB)的位址。對於Kerberos、NTLM或Negotiate認證，必須呼叫CredUnPackAuthenticationBuffer將BLOB轉換成字串形式的認證資訊
ppvOutAuthBuffer的大小，單位為byte
對於輸入而言，用於決定"儲存認證"是否被核取；對於輸出而言，用於取得認證資訊視窗的"儲存認證"是否被核取。 如果dwFlags的參數沒有設定，將會略過這個值
相關的設定，可以用 or 來設定一個或多個值

remarks.para: 關於詳細原文說明，請參考 http://msdn.microsoft.com/zh-tw/library/aa375177.aspx

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.AuthenticationPrompt.CredUnPackAuthenticationBuffer(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32@,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32@,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32@)
member.summary: 轉換由呼叫 後傳回的ppvOutAuthBuffer為使用者名稱以及密碼
member.param: 設定本參數來決定於認證緩衝區(authentication buffer)的解密方式，如果無法順利解密，本方法將傳回false。 要如何輸入解密方式取決於認證緩衝區(authentication buffer)的格式。
這個值應該由呼叫或 CredPackAuthenticationBuffer來得到。
pAuthBuffer參數的大小，單位為bytes
使用者名稱
pszUserName的字串大小。 對於輸出時，如果輸出大小超過緩衝區大小，請指定其值，這個值也包含表示null的字元
表示使用者的網域
pszDomainName的字串大小。 對於輸出時，如果輸出大小超過緩衝區大小，請指定其值。如果沒有網域名稱，也可以設定為0
密碼
pszPassword的字串大小。 對於輸出時，如果輸出大小超過緩衝區大小，請指定其值，這個值也包含表示null的字元
member.returns: 是否成功解密資料

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUI_FLAGS.EXPECT_CONFIRMATION

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.CREDUI_FLAGS.GENERIC_CREDENTIALS

member.name: T:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonProvider
member.summary: 登入提供者

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonProvider.LOGON32_PROVIDER_DEFAULT
member.summary: 使用該系統的基本登入提供者，預設安全性提供者為交涉驗證(negotiate)， 除非您將網域名稱設定為null以及使用名稱非UPN格式，目前而言，預設提供者是NTLM。 注意：當系統為Windows 2000/NT時，預設安全性提供者是NTLM

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonProvider.LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT35
member.summary: Windows NT 3.5 登入提供者

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonProvider.LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT40
member.summary: NTLM 登入提供者

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonProvider.LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT50
member.summary: 交涉驗證 登入提供者

member.name: T:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType
member.summary: Windows 登入方式的列舉

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE
member.summary: 本登入類型適用於要與電腦互動的使用者，舉一個使用者的例子來說，他可以透過終端伺服器、遠端指令等類似的程式來登入。 這種登入類型當中斷操作時，會因為快取使用者的登入資訊造成額外的負擔，因此，這種登入方式不是用於client/server的應用程式。 如郵件伺服器(mail server)等等。

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK
member.summary: 本登入類型適用於讓高效能的伺服器來驗證明文密碼。 本方式的LogonUser方法不會快取任何認證(Credentials)。

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_BATCH
member.summary: 本登入類型適用於批次伺服器(batch servers)，程式有可能被某個代表使用者執行，換句話說，這個程式並不是由使用者直接執行的。 本登入類型也適用於讓高效能的伺服器來同時驗證多組明文密碼，舉例來說，像是郵件或是網路伺服器。 本方式的LogonUser方法不會快取任何認證(Credentials)。

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_SERVICE
member.summary: 以服務類型為登入方式，所提供的帳戶必須要允許「透過服務方式登入」。

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_UNLOCK
member.summary: 本登入類型讓使用者能用GINA DLL來跟電腦互動的登入方式。 當工作站被鎖定時，本登入類型能在工作站解除鎖定時產生可被識別的稽核紀錄。

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT
member.summary: 本登入類型將會將帳號與密碼保留在認證模組中，這樣可以讓工作站模擬使用者連接其他網路上的伺服器， 伺服器可以接受客戶端的明文認證，透過LogonUser方法，驗證該使用者可以存取網路上的系統，並且仍然可以與其他伺服器溝通。 注意：本方法不適用於 Windows NT

member.name: F:TEC.Core.Security.Logon.LogonType.LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS
member.summary: 本登入類型可以讓呼叫者複製目前的token並且為連出的連接指定新的認證。 新的登入階段仍會有相同的本機識別，但對於其他網路連線而言將會是使用不同的認證。 注意：本登入類型指使用於透過 LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT50 為登入提供者 注意：本方法不適用於 Windows NT

member.summary: 以字串連接指定物件中被標記為 的屬性值
member.param: 要序列化的物件
每個值所要使用的連接字串
輸入指定屬性的型別與值，傳回可以表示該值的字串
member.returns: 傳回序列化後的結果

member.name: T:TEC.Core.Text.Format.OrderedMemberFormatter
member.summary: 將指定物件中被標記為之屬性格式化文字之類別

example.code:
<summary>
            描述銀行對帳單的一筆資料
            </summary>
            public class BankEOD
            {
                /// < summary>
                /// 設定或取得交易代號
                /// < /summary>
                [OrderedFormatMember(0), PadingStringFormat(' ', 30, PadingDirection.PadRight)]
                public string TransactionId { set; get; }
                /// < summary>
                /// 設定或取得銀行代碼
                /// < /summary>
                [OrderedFormatMember(1), PadingStringFormat(' ', 9, CaddingDirection.PadRight)]
                public string BankCode { set; get; }
                /// < summary>
                /// 設定或取得應付帳款
                /// < /summary>
                [OrderedFormatMember(2), PadingStringFormat('0', 20, PadingDirection.PadLeft)]
                public string AccountPayable { set; get; }
                /// < summary>
                /// 設定或取得應收帳款
                /// < /summary>
                [OrderedFormatMember(3), PadingStringFormat('0', 20, PadingDirection.PadLeft)]
                public string AccountReceivable { set; get; }
                /// < summary>
                /// 設定或取得狀態代號
                /// < /summary>
                [OrderedFormatMember(4), PadingStringFormat(' ', 10, PadingDirection.PadLeft)]
                public string StatusCode { set; get; }
            }

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Text.StringExtension.subStringByByte(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: 由系統預設編碼方式擷取由索引位置0起始的位元組單位的字串長度
member.param: 要擷取的字串
擷取的字串長度(以位元組為單位)
member.returns: 擷取後的字串

example.code: //using TEC.Core.Text string str8 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(4);//原始(系統預設編碼為 Big5) string str9 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(5);//原始(系統預設編碼為 Big5) string str10 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(6);//原始文(系統預設編碼為 Big5)

member.name: M:TEC.Core.Text.StringExtension.subStringByByte(System.String,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: 由系統預設編碼方式擷取由索引位置0起始的位元組單位的字串長度
member.param: 要擷取的字串
當超過輸入的位元組數時，將在擷取後的文字後方加上此字串
擷取的字串長度(以位元組為單位)
member.returns: 擷取後的字串

example.code: //using TEC.Core.Text string str11 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(4, "...");//原始...(系統預設編碼為 Big5) string str12 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(5, "...");//原始...(系統預設編碼為 Big5) string str13 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(6, "...");//原始文...(系統預設編碼為 Big5) string str14 = "原始文字".subStringByByte(10, "...");//原始文字(系統預設編碼為 Big5)
